text: Ancient Moirang, also known as Keke Moirang,Keke Moirang And Ngangoi Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 4 was an ancient civilization that flourished in the southern plains of the present day Manipur, India.History of Moirang Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 5 The Keke Kangla served as the capital city of the kingdom since time immemorial.Keke Kangla Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 3 The major body of accounts related to the history, literature, mythology of the kingdom are collectively called Moirang Kangleirol. ==History== The kingdom flourished about the same time as the Chinese Golden Ages. The period started from 52 BC in Moirang and 208 BC in China.Contemporary Periods Of Moirang And Chinese Golden Ages Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 8 ===Genealogy of ancient rulers=== The Moirang Ningthourol (genealogy of the ancient rulers) were calculated with reference to many ancient texts, including the Cheitharol Kumpapa.Moirang Ningthourol Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 6 ===Administration and Commerce=== The Iwang Puriklai (ruler of Moirang) was the absolute monarch of the kingdom. For a smooth and sound administration, the kingdom was divided into eight leikais (wards or sectors). Along with this division, there were also nine organized marketplaces.Eight Leikais And Nine Market Places Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 7 There were various institutions of the Phamnaiba Loishangs (Offices hold by Scholars), for smooth and proper conduct of the Thangjing Haraoba in the kingdom.Institution Of Phamnaiba Loishang Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 14 ===Religion=== The ancient people worshipped Lord Thangjing, the presiding deity, as the founder of the kingdom.Ebuthou Thangjing Moirang Kangleirol Part 2Moirang and Ebuthou Thangjing Part 1 ==Related pages== * Moirang * Iputhou Pakhangba Laishang * Ancient Manipur ==References== Category:Ancient India Category:Meitei culture Category:History of Manipur
title: Ancient Moirang
